from collections import namedtuple 

N = int(input()) 
cols = input().split() 

Student = namedtuple('Student', cols) 
students = [Student(*input().split()) for _ in range(N)] 

print("{:.2f}".format(sum(float(s.MARKS) for s in students) / N))  
#!/bin/python3

from __future__ import print_function
from collections import namedtuple

N = int(input())
marks = namedtuple('marks', input())

total = 0.0
for i in range(N):
    total += int(marks(*input().split()).MARKS)  # marks is a class

print(total / N)

from collections import namedtuple

N = int(input())
marks = namedtuple('marks', input())

total = 0.0
for i in range(N):
    total += int(marks(*input().split()).MARKS) # marks(*input().split()).MARKS

print(total / N)

from __future__ import print_function
from collections import namedtuple

N = int(input())
marks = namedtuple('marks', input())

total = 0.0
for i in range(N):
    total += int(marks(*input().split()).MARKS)

print(total / N)
